abstract: State and city officials inform developers of nearly 200 small buildings in New York City, most of them in Brooklyn, that they have violated terms of state's 421-a property tax breaks by not registering required number of apartments with the state as rent-stabilized units; failure to comply may result in penalties of up to repayment of past tax benefits.
lead_paragraph: Developers of nearly 200 small buildings in New York City have flouted the terms of tax incentives they received by failing to place their apartments on the rent-stabilization rolls, state and city officials said.

headline.main: Nearly 200 Buildings in New York City Flouted Tax Rules, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Tax Rules for Rentals Are Flouted, Officials Say

snippet: Developers of nearly 200 small buildings in New York City have flouted the terms of tax incentives they received by failing to place their apartments on the rent-stabilization rolls, state and city officials said.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
